Essential oils of these three plants have a potential to be used for personal protection
Ticks belong to a group of exclusively blood-feeding ectoparasites (Elmhalli et al.
). From the medical point of view, ticks are the second most important group of
disease vectors after mosquitoes. The pathogenic agents transmitted by ticks affect the
public health and cause economic losses in livestock sector (Svehlova et al.
Mediterranean region offers suitable environment for a wide range of tick species
). The geographical distribution of ticks has continued to increase
over the past three decades (Tabanca et al.
bution might be modiﬁed by future climate and environmental changes (Jore et al.
(L.) (Acari: Ixodidae), is a triphasic tick that para-
sitizes a large number of vertebrates including small, medium to large mammals; birds and

wooded area of Southern Italy was determined by Dantas-Torres and Otranto (

higher than on the higher vegetation whereas both nymphs and adult stages were more
abundant on higher vegetation. The questing behavior of
low vegetation to a point from where it can attach to the passing hosts. The host-seeking
activity of the castor-bean tick indicated that this tick has a bimodal seasonal activity with
a dominant peak during spring whereas a minor peak during autumn (Schulz et al.
The immature stages (larvae and nymphs) feed on woodland birds and small to medium-
sized mammals while the adult female feeds on large mammals. Each life stage (larva,
nymph, adult) of this tick feeds once on different host for continuous period lasting several
is a potential vector of different pathogens. The cattle parasite,
